people.name: Gerty Cori
people.description: Gerty Theresa Cori  was a Czech-American biochemist who became the third woman—and first American woman—to win a Nobel Prize in science, and the first woman to be awarded the Nobel Prize in Physiology or Medicine.

people.name: Lyman Spitzer
people.description: Lyman Strong Spitzer, Jr.   was an American theoretical physicist, astronomer and mountaineer.

people.name: Edwin Hubble
people.description: Edwin Powell Hubble  was an American astronomer who played a crucial role in establishing the field of extragalactic astronomy and is generally regarded as one of the most important observational cosmologists of the 20th century.

people.name: Heber Doust Curtis
people.description: Heber Doust Curtis  was an American astronomer.  He participated in 11 expeditions for the study of solar eclipses.

people.name: Duke Ellington
people.description: Edward Kennedy "Duke" Ellington  was an American composer, pianist, and bandleader of a jazz orchestra, which he led from 1923 until his death in a career spanning over fifty years.

people.name: William Wilson Morgan
people.description: William Wilson Morgan  was an American astronomer and astrophysicist.

people.name: Walter Sydney Adams
people.description: Walter Sydney Adams  was an American astronomer.

people.name: Edwin Hubble
people.description: Edwin Powell Hubble  was an American astronomer who played a crucial role in establishing the field of extragalactic astronomy and is generally regarded as one of the most important observational cosmologists of the 20th century.

people.name: John E. Colhoun
people.description: John Ewing Colhoun  was a United States Senator and lawyer from South Carolina.

people.name: The Demon
people.description: Brian Keith Adams  was an American professional wrestler.

people.name: Edward Charles Pickering
people.description: Edward Charles Pickering  was an American astronomer and physicist as well as the older brother of William Henry Pickering.
